Package pcricketstats

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CricketStatsApp  
    Player
    The Player class, which is responsible for the creation of each player.
    ReadInStats
    This class is a utilities class, which is responsible for: reading in player information from a CSV file,
    SortByBallsBowled
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by the amount of balls they have bowled.
    SortByBowlingAverage
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by the players bowling average.
    SortByCareerSpan
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by the length of a players career (in years).
    SortByCountryName
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by their country name.
    SortByEconomyRate
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by their bowling economy rate.
    SortByFiveWicketsInn
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by how many innings they got 5 wickets in.
    SortByInningsPlayed
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by how many innings they have played.
    SortByMatchesPlayed
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by how many matches they have played.
    SortByPlayerName
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players alphabetically by their name.
    SortByRunsConceded
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by how many runs they have conceded.
    SortByStrikeRate
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by their bowling strike rate.
    SortByWicketsTaken
    This is the Comparator class, which is used to sort a list of players by how many wickets they have taken.
    StatUtilities
    This is the class responsible for calculating statistics from the data in the CSV file.The outputSort method handles the sorting - by providing the user with options specified by an integer value.The sorting itself is handled by the Comparator classes.
